TopicTitle: Occlusion on intakes/engines mounted in wings

Articles.Content: Not trying to clip spam here. But I was wondering if being mounted (clipped) in a wing can cause issues with engines or intakes from possible occlusion?
Nope, it'll work fine, occlusion is via the stack nodes for aero, though for heat (heatshields) there's a generous occlusion area that will cover most stuff behind the shield.
Ok, so just to confirm if I see the wing literally inside of the intake and/or engines, it won't have any negative effects?

Well, depending on the engine it may be blocked by the wing, you won't want the wing inside the engines nozzle.

If it is you will see the engine damaging the wing in the F3 flight results window.
Gotcha. What about intakes in the same situation?
